title: [Self-Directed] GIS Fundamentals and Applications Course for Practitioners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and general understanding of geographic information systems (GIS)
context.additional_context: Flexible curriculum utilizing learning-object-based content modules. Blended learning environment combining online content (theory/simulation) with offline practicals (spatial analysis projects).

learning_goals: Apply fundamental GIS tools and workflows for spatial data collection, analysis, and visualization with 80% accuracy.
Create three or more thematic maps (e.g., population distribution maps) using QGIS/ArcGIS software.

Learners analyze three scenario-based practical tasks (urban planning, environmental monitoring, logistics optimization) in an object-based module, propose one or more GIS solutions per scenario, and achieve an "excellent" grade in at least two of three rubric criteria (problem definition clarity, technical feasibility, implementability).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
